intro: Ostrearia australiana, commonly known as the Australian ostrearia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, pink to red floral spikes. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its flowers are borne on long, branching inflorescences and attract various pollinators, including birds and insects. Ostrearia australiana is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
